name: Courtyard by Marriott Hamilton

reviews.text: This hotel is a great business hotel and I would highly recommend it to others. One of the biggest reasons is I got an amazing deal on priceline which made this hotel extremely affordable.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel - Clean and Comfortable

reviews.text: The location of this ok - as there are a lot of restaurants and shops within driving distance. If you are going to McMaster University or McMaster University Hospital - it is within a close driving distance.
reviews.title: nice and clean good value

reviews.text: The hotel was modern and well kept. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and well mannered. The room was clean, modern, and has extremely comfortable beds (which is has been consistent at all the Marriot properties I have stayed at.
reviews.title: last minute travel

reviews.text: I had the breakfast buffet - and it was pretty good. It is a bit expensive but the food was fresh and the staff were excellent.
reviews.title: Good hotel on Mountain

reviews.text: Parking and internet is free which is always a bonus.
reviews.title: Only place worth staying on the mountain.

reviews.text: We have now stayed at this property a few times with our children and have had great experiences both times. We appreciate the extra lengths that the staff go to in accommodating family and young children. The children loved the pool and had a great time playing. We heard nothing at night, it was peaceful and the children slept well. I was shocked to read the complaint of mice in January of 2011 considering we also stayed at this property during that time. I was naturally curious and looked on "youtube" for the video as promised, and yet there is nothing. I have to say we have stayed in many hotels over the years and this hotel is impeccably kept and the housekeeping staff take pride in their work. I would highly recommend the property to anyone. The buffet breakfast is a little pricey, but it is worth it, or book it with your room for $5.00.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed here since my son is admitted to McMaster hospital in Hamilton. Please be warned, this hotel is like 20 mins away from the hospital! I really liked the hotel, it was clean, quiet and best of all, comfy pillows! I was tired, slept like the dead, had a nice shower and checked out. I can't judge the pool or any other amenities since I didnt use them but I thank them for a decent nights sleep...zzz
reviews.title: Nice, clean and comfy pillows...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable, clean, best beds around! No complaints here!
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: Young boys (approx age 8-10 years old) were playing hockey in the hallways at 11pm. After notifying reception of the excessive noise and inappropriate activity, it was not until 2am when we "personally" went & asked the boys to move their activities to the front lobby that we were able to finally settle.
reviews.title: Hotel staff do not take noise complaints seriously

reviews.text: It is not acceptable that these children were allowed to play in the hallways, unsupervised in the middle of the night.
reviews.title: Everything you'd expect and nothing you don't
MARRIOTT MICE!!!!!
reviews.text: I am compelled to write my review of this hotel, as I use Trip Advisor to review the write-ups from travelers on cleanliness and overall satisfaction before I make hotel arrangements. We travel quite frequently with my son and daughter's sports teams.

reviews.title: I would come back
reviews.text: This hotel presented as clean and the staff at check-in were satisfactory. Our team was socializing in the hallway that evening and noticed movement at the end of the hallway. Our videographer on the team decided to place his camera and videotape the mice, which traveled from room to room over a period of a couple of hours. I did not witness as I was asleep in my room, but was shown the video....which was extremely disturbing!!!!

reviews.title: Excellent stay!
reviews.text: I contacted the hotel on various...yes various occasions. The manager refused to return my call. I received a message from the Marriott Corporate office to state that "it was obvious that the mice were pet mice and that we, as a team, placed them there???!!!!! This was extremely insulting!! They obviously have no intention of correcting the problem.

reviews.title: Worst hotel stay experience ever!!!
reviews.text: My reasons for this review......PLEASE do not stay here. The best and only response would be to have corrective measures in place to rid themselves of these rodents. I travel for business very frequently and couldn't believe the response from Marriott! Customer service and cleanliness of their hotels is not their priority.

reviews.title: Not really near anything, lovely property though
reviews.text: Stay tuned... plan on posting the video on You Tube entitled Marriott Mice...see for yourself the "pet mice".....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveling between Northern Michigan and the Finger Lakes of New York State, we decided to stay overnight in Hamilton, Ontario. We invariably choose a Marriott facility when available.
reviews.title: Well Appointed!

reviews.text: This Courtyard was conveniently close to the freeway. It was well appointed, with a charming courtyard, comfortable rooms, comfortable beds and pillows, and a small in-room refrigerator.
reviews.title: A Grave Experience

reviews.text: All in all, a much better than average motel, reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Pricey but worth it if flying to Hamilton

reviews.text: I generally like Marriott properties so I was pleased when I made a bid on Priceline and was given the Hamilton Courtyard as my choice for my family travelling through Hamilton.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, comfortable beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is fine (clean and modern) but I can't believe nobody has bothered to mention that there's a cemetery in the front yard! We did not get a view of the pretty Japanese courtyard, but we did get an attitude from the front desk staff because we requested a room with 2 beds - apparently if you book though a discounter they'll make sure you get a single bed room overlooking the graveyard. She said we couldn't have a double room because we booked thought Priceline but there's a sofa bed- and there was a tiny one...with no bedding. She was equally as pleasant when my husband went downstairs to get some. The hotel was not full, so I don't see why she couldn't simply accommodate us.
reviews.title: Second stay and overall pleasant.
